article.name: Merge Users
article.title: Merge Users
article.body:
You can merge duplicate users with our Merge Users tool. With this tool, you'll be able to safely transfer important phishing and training data to the user profile you want to keep. 

Important:Merging users is a permanent change to your console. The removed user profile cannot be recovered after the merge.

Merge Users

To merge users, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your KSAT console.
  2. Navigate to Users > Merge Users.
  3. In the Select Target User field, select the user profile you would like to keep in the console.
    Important:If you're a Platinum or Diamond customer and your organization uses Security Roles, the merged user will assume the rights of the target user after the merge is complete.
  4. In the Select Merge User field, select the user profile you would like to remove from the console. 
  5. Once both users are selected, you will see all of the data that will be retained from each user. See the image below for an example.
  6. After reviewing the data, click Merge Users at the bottom of the page to merge the data.

Retaining Data with the Merge Users Tool

With phishing campaigns, if both users participated in the same campaign, the user data with phishing failures will be retained. If only one user profile participated in the phishing campaign, that data will be retained regardless of which user profile had the failure.

With training campaigns, if both user profiles participated in the same campaign, the user data with the most progress will be retained. If only one user profile participated in the training campaign, that data will be retained regardless of which user profile took the training.

Admin privileges and Security Role permissions are only retained if they originally belonged to the target user you want to keep. Additionally, group membership and user profile data from the merged user will not be copied to the target user. The user that is created after the merge will retain the group membership and user profile of the target user.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface for merging two user accounts within an administration console.

**Context and Navigation:**
The current view is indicated by the active tab, **"Merge Users,"** located in a header navigation bar that also includes tabs for **Users, Groups, Import Users, Provisioning,** and **Security Roles.**

**User Selection Fields:**
The interface provides two primary input fields for user selection:

1.  **Select Target User:** (The user account that will be retained).
    *   Input displays: **Adrian Lueilwitz - Adrian.Lueilwitz@professorphisher.com**
    *   Accompanied by a standard blue user icon.

2.  **Select Merge User:** (The user account whose data will be transferred, and which will then be deleted).
    *   Input displays: **- alueilwitz@professorphisher.com**
    *   Accompanied by a red user icon with a plus sign.

Both fields are labeled with a help icon (question mark).

**Confirmation Banner:**
A prominent warning or confirmation banner with a light orange background is displayed below the selection fields, summarizing the action:

Text reads: **"After the merge, (alueilwitz@professorphisher.com) will be deleted, and Adrian Lueilwitz (Adrian.Lueilwitz@professorphisher.com) will have the following data ..."**

*   The deleted user's email is highlighted in red text.
*   The retained user's name and email are highlighted in blue bold text.

Log in to your KSAT console.
Navigate to Users > Merge Users.

images.alt:
This interface displays a User Merge confirmation screen detailing the data assets to be transferred between two users.

**Header Section (User Selection):**
*   **Select Target User:** Input field shows "Fritz Connell - Fritz.Connell@kb4-demo.com" with a blue person icon (Source indicator).
*   **Select Merge User:** Input field shows "Fritz OConnell - Fritz.OConnell@kb4-demo.com" with a red person icon overlaid with a plus sign (Source indicator).
*   **Warning Banner (Yellow/Orange):** "After the merge, **Fritz OConnell (Fritz.OConnell@kb4-demo.com)** will be deleted, and **Fritz Connell (Fritz.Connell@kb4-demo.com)** will have the following data ..."

**Groups Section:**
A table lists groups associated with the users, with columns for `Name` and `Source`.
*   `kb4-demo.com` (Source: Blue icon)
*   `Accounting` (Source: Blue icon)
*   `Marketing` (Source: Blue icon)
*   `SG Northwest Failed Post Training (Manager Jones)` (Source: Red/Plus icon)

**Phishing Campaigns Section (Header includes help icon):**
This section lists two campaigns with columns for `Email Date`, `Clicked`, `Attachment Opened`, `Name`, `Data Entered`, `Exploited`, `Reported`, and `Source`.

1.  **Initial Campaign:**
    *   Row 1: `02/10/2020 1:54 AM`, `Clicked`: Checked (Black checkmark), `Source`: Blue icon.
2.  **Current Events and Social Networking:**
    *   Row 1: `04/25/2020 2:44 AM`, `Source`: Blue icon.

**Training Campaigns Section (Header includes help icon):**
This section details training activities, grouped by campaigns, with columns for `Course`, `Status`, `Time Spent`, and `Source`.

1.  **Initial Campaign** (Dropdown selected):
    *   `Security Awareness Proficiency Assessment`, `Status`: `Completed`, `Time Spent`: `00:16:00`, `Source`: Red/Plus icon.
2.  **2020 Security Culture Survey:**
    *   `Security Culture Survey`, `Status`: `Completed`, `Time Spent`: `00:20:00`, `Source`: Red/Plus icon.
3.  **new hires:**
    *   `Security Awareness Proficiency Assessment`, `Status`: `Not started`, `Source`: Blue icon.
    *   `2019 Your Role: Internet Security and You`, `Status`: `Not started`, `Source`: Blue icon.
